THOMAS D. RISHUORTH - PERSONAL DATS
Date of "birth: Feb. 13, 1907 Place: St. Paul, Minnesota
Employment record:
Radio Director, National Music Camp, Interlochen, Michigan
(1952 - summer only)
Director of Radio House, Coordinator of Radio-Television,
University of Texas (1946-1952)
Educational Consultant, South Texas Television Co., Houston,
Texas (l951-l°52)
Manager of Program Sales, National Broadcasting Co., New York
(1945-1946)
Director of Public Service Programs Dept., National Broadcasting
Co., New York (1941-1942)
Educational Director, Station KSTP, St. Paul, Minnesota
(1929-1941)
Lecturer in radio (part time), College of St. Catherine,
St. Paul, Minnesota (1935-1940)
Lecturer in radio (part time). College of St. Thomas, St. Paul,
Minnesota (1936-1940)
Army service record:
U.S. Army Air Forces (1942-1945). assigned to Public Relations
Division as director of two Army war exhibits on cross¬
country tours: ”The Four Freedoms Show” and ”Shot From
the Sky.”
Professional and public service record:
National President, University Association for Professional
Radio Education (1951-1952)
Member, White House Broadcast Advisory Council (1951-1952)
National Chairman, Committee on Radio and Television, National
Congress of Parents and Teachers (1949-1952)
Member, Board of Directors, Travis County (Texas) Tuberculosis
Association (1949-1952)
Member, Board of Directors, Travis Area (Texas) Girl Scouts
of America (1951-1952)
Delegate, U.S. Commission, United Nations Educational, Scientific,
and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) (1951)
Member, Judges' Committee, Peabody Radio Awards (1948-1952)
Vice-President, Austin Symphony Orchestra Society (l950~195l)
Member, Committee of Jusges, American Exhibition of Recordings
of Educational Programs (Ohio State University) (1950
and 1940)
National Vice-President, Association for Education by Radio-
Television (19^7-19-48)
Member, Public Affairs Committee, New York (1941-1942)
Member, National Public Relations Committee, National Council
of YMCA (1941-1943)
